author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Protests in Nepal, Shooting in Jerusalem, and Total Lunar Eclipse

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The RCMP announced on Sept. 8 that three men who assisted in the 2022 escape of convicted murderer Rabih Alkhalil from a B.C. jail have been charged with conspiracy to commit prison breach. The three men were named as Edward Ayoub, 48, and John Potvin, 49, of Ottawa along with Ryan van Gool, 46, of […]
title: RCMP Charge 3 Men in 2022 BC Jailbreak of Convicted Murderer Rabih Alkhalil

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Self-proclaimed “Queen of Canada” and compound leader Romana Didulo has been granted bail for a second time after being arrested twice last week, first during an RCMP raid and again a day later for allegedly breaching the conditions of her release. Didulo was released on Sept. 8 with strict conditions and an order to remain […]
title: Self-Declared ‘Queen of Canada’ Granted Bail, Must Remain in Regina

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The Navy's new drone attack boat program could be a key part of U.S. strategy to counter China's battle strategy in the Indo-Pacific.
title: The Drone Attack Boat Program Critical to Countering China

author: Noé Chartier
description: Canada’s mostly Quebec-based aluminum sector will receive its “fair share” of a newly announced $5 billion fund to help businesses impacted by U.S. tariffs, according to Industry Minister Mélanie Joly. Joly’s comments came after Prime Minister Mark Carney announced a series of new measures on Sept. 5 for workers and businesses impacted by U.S. tariffs. […]
title: Aluminum Sector to Receive ‘Hundreds of Millions’ From $5B Relief Fund: Minister Joly

author: The Canadian Press
description: An Ottawa man has been sentenced to ten years in prison for the promotion of hate propaganda against Jewish people produced for the neo-Nazi group Atomwaffen Division. Superior Court Justice Robert Smith found Patrick Gordon MacDonald guilty earlier this year on all three charges brought against him: promoting hate speech, participating in the activities of […]
title: Ottawa Man Sentenced to 10 Years in Neo-Nazi Terrorist Propaganda Trial

author: The Canadian Press
description: Businesses in Atlantic Canada will be able to access $80 million of the $1 billion tariff relief fund set up by the federal government, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Monday. Ottawa set aside $1 billion for a regional tariff response initiative to help small and medium-sized businesses diversify their markets and adopt new technologies. That […]
title: Prime Minister Mark Carney Details Tariff Relief Funding for Atlantic Businesses

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Niagara Regional Police say there is no longer any threat to public safety after apprehending a suspect during a search for an armed man in West Lincoln, Ont. Police arrested a male suspect on the morning of Sept. 8, bringing an end to a shelter-in-place request for the residents of West Lincoln, a township in […]
title: Arrest Made by Niagara Police During Hunt for Armed Man

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canadians are divided on whether Ottawa should eliminate its temporary foreign worker program, although the scales tip in favour of scrapping the program, a new survey suggests. Forty-four percent of Canadians said they support a recent proposal by Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre to phase out the temporary foreign worker program (TFWP) while 30 percent are […]
title: 44% of Canadians Want to End Temporary Foreign Worker Program, 30% Disagree: Poll

author: Owen Evans
description: Prime Minister François Bayrou has been ousted, leaving President Macron scrambling again for a path through France's economic turmoil.
title: French Prime Minister Loses Confidence Vote, Triggering Collapse of Government

author: Noé Chartier
description: As Ottawa embarks on a 60-day review of its electric vehicle (EV) mandate, Industry Minister Mélanie Joly says the plan is not to get rid of the policy but rather to boost the production and importation of the vehicles. “We want to build more EVs in Canada. We need to because we know that’s where […]
title: Ottawa Won’t Scrap EV Mandate, Wants Increased Imports, Domestic Production: Industry Minister

author: Bill Pan
description: Trump told reporters that he was 'not thrilled' by the latest attacks on Ukrainian cities and suggested new sanctions.
title: Russian Attack Shows Unwillingness to Negotiate War’s End, US Envoy Says

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Transportation Safety Board of Canada says it is sending a team of investigators to the Caribbean island of St. Maarten to investigate the rough landing of a WestJet plane yesterday. The safety board says it will gather information and assess what happened to flight WS2276 from Toronto that experienced a hard landing upon arrival […]
title: Canada’s Transportation Safety Board to Investigate St. Maarten WestJet Hard Landing

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The outcome in the Argentinian capital region highlighted challenges for President Javier Milei ahead of October’s midterms.
title: Peronists Defeat Milei in Buenos Aires Legislative Elections

author: Phil Gurski
description: Commentary Some 42 years ago, I found myself in a sparsely-decorated office in the Sir Leonard Tilley Building, part of a government complex in the southern part of Ottawa. I was there to receive my “indoctrination” for what I had been led to believe was a job as a multilingual analyst for the Department of […]
title: China’s Political and Cyber Warfare: Why Canada Needs to Wake Up Now

author: Dorothy Li
description: Despite August's weak export growth, China ended the first eight months with a trade surplus exceeding $785 billion.
title: Chinese Exports to US Plunged 33 Percent in August

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Thirty-seven percent of Canadian university students with right-leaning views fear facing formal consequences—including lower grades—if they share an opinion in class that differs from the accepted “safe” stance on controversial topics, a new poll suggests. A recently released study from the Fraser Institute found that left-leaning political viewpoints are dominant on university campuses in Canada, […]
title: 37% of Right-Leaning Canadian University Students Fear Reprisal for Sharing Honest Opinions in Class: Poll

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Restrictions appeared to coincide with the CHP’s calls for public gatherings after police erected barricades around its provincial headquarters in Istanbul.
title: Access to Major Social Media Platforms Restricted in Turkey, Internet Watchdog Says

author: The Canadian Press
description: Doctors are calling for restrictions on sports betting ads, saying they are setting youth up for a future of problem gambling. An editorial published in the Canadian Medical Association Journal on Monday says the ads are everywhere during sports broadcasts and that the legalization of online gambling has made every smartphone a potential betting platform. […]
title: Onslaught of Sports Betting Ads Make Gambling Seem Enticing to Youth, Doctors Say

author: Adam Morrow
description: A government building in Kyiv was set ablaze during what Ukrainian officials say was the largest drone attack by Russia since the conflict began in early 2022.
title: Russia Pounds Ukraine With Missiles, Drones in ‘Massive’ Attack: Russian Defense Ministry

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: Speculators have raised their long positions on Brent and WTI oil, signaling investors are bullish on prices.
title: Oil Prices Spike Amid Modest Supply Boost by OPEC+, War Tensions

author: Alfred Bui, Daniel Y. Teng
description: 'The fear goes to so many people that they sometimes don't feel that it's fear anymore, or they don't think they're losing their freedom this way,' said Lei.
title: ‘It’s Not Right’: Former CCP Political Prisoner Calls out Deep Fear of Beijing in Australia

author: Alex Wu
description: Such a display of military power reaffirms that the CCP is the threat to world democracy and peace, analysts say.
title: China’s Parade Reveals Limitations in Military Development: Analysts

author: Chris Summers
description: 'No one is going to step on this land and do what we're supposed to do,' Venezuela's defense minister said.
title: Venezuela Says It Is Sending Extra Troops to Coast to Stop Drug Traffickers

author: Guy Birchall
description: Tariffs, tech, and defense spending have all proved to be trans-Atlantic challenges, but Antonio Costa said relations were warming.
title: EU Council President Says Bloc Has ‘Turned the Page’ With Trump

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Israeli police say gunmen opened fire on the outskirts of Jerusalem, killing four and wounding at least 15 before being shot dead.
title: Shooting Near Jerusalem Kills 4 People

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: From Bob Katter's clash with a journalist, to national protests last week, immigration policy continues to be a major talking point.
title: How Senator Price’s Remarks on Immigration and Indian Migrants Stirred Up a Storm

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: What started as a custody battle escalated to armed robbery and, finally, shooting a police officer in the head before fugitive Tom Phillips was gunned down.
title: 4-Year Manhunt Ends With Shooting of New Zealand Fugitive; Police Still Looking for 2 Children

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The flag pole carrying the Israeli flag has been damaged with the flag nowhere to be seen, officials say.
title: Police Investigate Israeli Flag Stolen From Canberra Flag Walk

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: New figures highlight surging inflows to lifestyle and jobs-rich centres even as overall moves fall 15 percent.
title: Migration to Regional Australia continues to Outpace Cities

author: Monica O’Shea
description: The federal gross debt is predicted to rise to $1.2 trillion in 2028-29.
title: Australia Can’t Keep Normalising Bigger Government and Endless Debt, Says Sussan Ley

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The actions related to overdraft fees, excess interest, and clawbacks of mortgage incentive payments. Over 200,000 customers were affected.
title: ANZ Bank Pays $3.25 Million Penalty for Misleading New Zealand Customers

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A total lunar eclipse, also known as a ‘blood moon’, was observed on Sunday from around the world as the moon turned a deep red as it entered Earth’s shadow.
title: In Photos: Blood Moon

author: Joseph Lord
description: President Donald Trump said he was 'not happy' about the current state of negotiations, Russia, or 'anything having to do with that war.'
title: Trump: European Leaders Will Visit This Week to Discuss Russia–Ukraine War

author: Joseph Lord
description: 'It's a problem we want to solve, for the Middle East, for Israel, for everybody,' President Donald Trump said on Sunday.
title: Trump Issues ‘Last Warning’ to Hamas, Promises Deal on Gaza ‘Very Soon’

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Journalist Cheng Lei was also critical of those who continue to promote the CCP warning of 'karma.'
title: Finding the Meaning of Freedom in Half an Egg: Political Prisoner’s Reflection After 1,000 Days Behind Chinese Bars

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: It comes as Russia launched more than 800 drones and missiles on Ukraine overnight on Sept. 7.
title: Trump Says US Ready for Second Phase of Russia Sanctions

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Australia’s eSafety Commissioner has launched enforcement action against a UK-based technology company responsible for AI-generated ‘nudify’ services.
title: Australia Launches Action Against AI ‘Nudify’ Sites as Child Sexual Exploitation Reports Jump 41 Percent

author: The Associated Press
description: TEL AVIV, Israel—A drone fired by Yemen’s Houthi terrorists breached Israel’s multilayered air defenses on Sunday and slammed into the country’s southern airport, the Israeli military said, blowing out glass windows, wounding one person and briefly shutting down commercial airspace. The damage to Ramon Airport appeared limited and flights resumed within hours. The Houthis claimed […]
title: Houthi Drone Strikes Israeli Airport as Israel Steps Up Gaza City Attacks

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Patterson showed little reaction as she was sentenced to life imprisonment.
title: ‘Mushroom Killer’ Erin Patterson Jailed for Life Over Deadly Lunch

author: John Robson
description: Commentary It is tempting to dismiss the federal government’s pledge of an austere budget after over half a century of similar rhetoric and because they’ve also promised massive spending increases. But as always, it’s important to see this idea from the inside. Then you can dismiss it … until you get the bill. The National […]
title: John Robson: How Can Austerity Be Achieved When Lavish Spending Prevails?

author: The Canadian Press
description: WestJet says a flight travelling from Toronto had a rough landing at an airport on the Caribbean island of St. Maarten on Sunday afternoon. The airline issued a statement on its website, saying the flight WS2276 from Toronto experienced a hard landing upon arrival at Princess Juliana International Airport at around 1 p.m. ET. It […]
title: WestJet Flight From Toronto Has Rough Landing in St. Maarten’s Airport
